title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel of the Jazz Age, exploring themes of decadence and excess.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: An exploration of the history and impact of Homo sapiens.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and attends a magical school.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist uncovers secrets hidden in the works of Leonardo da Vinci.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A science fiction saga about politics, religion, and power on the desert planet Arrakis.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: The authorized biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and childhood in the American South.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about growing up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A hobbit's adventure to help dwarves reclaim their mountain home from a dragon.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A thriller about a marriage gone wrong and the secrets it hides.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars and must find a way to survive.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: A memoir by the former First Lady of the United States.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that also critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
description: The story of Henrietta Lacks and the immortal cell line, known as HeLa, that came from her cervical cancer cells.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: A fantasy novel about a young man who grows up to become a famous figure.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A mystery novel involving a journalist and a computer hacker.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A science fiction novel that helped define the cyberpunk genre.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The wartime diary of a Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and control to maintain power.

title: Outliers: The Story of Success
author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: An analysis of the factors that contribute to high levels of success.
